description: Growing up, I was always fascinated by how systems work and how they could be broken or made. This curiosity led me to explore computers, networks, and eventually cybersecurity.

I pursued my Bachelor's in Software Systems Engineering at the University of Regina where I developed strong fundamentals in networking and security. During this time, I gained hands-on experience through various roles from safety compliance at Co-op Refinery Complex to warehouse operations, which taught me discipline, attention to detail, and teamwork in high-risk environments.

I'm currently a Student at UIT studying B.Tech in CyberSecurity and working as a Network Security Engineer Intern at ProSec India, implementing enterprise network security infrastructure with firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and SIEM solutions. I continuously sharpen my skills through CTF platforms like TryHackMe and Hack The Box, building home labs, and working on real-world security projects. I'm actively preparing for the Azure AZ-500 certification and looking for opportunities in security engineering, SOC analysis, and cloud security.
